alert.note: Alert for Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 8:58PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CHERRY AND NORTHEASTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM MDT... At 758 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Gordon, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Hoover Lake, Lone Butte, Irwin, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill, Bayonne, and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road. This includes Highway 20 between mile markers 102 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
